questions.text: Which dam was formerly named Osmeña Waterworks when it was finished in 1912?

Easy one: Miguel Lopez de Legaspi established residence on this street.

Cebu's Foundation Day? Month and day only.
Magellan brought Spaniards with him but he was actually from what country?
Cebu province has how many component cities?
Mt. Pinatubo, the name of the C-47 plane carrying Magsaysay, ironically crashed against which mountain?
Before it become unoperational due to damages from WWII, Cebu's railway connected which towns?
What was the gift of Ferdinand Magellan to Rajah Humabon and Queen Juana for their baptism into the Christianity?

Like Colgate became a term tooth paste, what refrigerator brand did the term 'frijider' come from?

This place was formerly known as Cárcel de Cebú.

Leon Kilat allegedly kept this mythical animal that gave him supernatural powers.
What is the family name of the late senator was the Father of Cebuano journalism, language, and literature? Clue: grandfather and same family name with one of popular aged local celebrities.
What other weapon did Lapu-Lapu hold before it was renovated into the sword and pestle he holds now?
It's island name means "Bad Easter" or "Unlucky Christmas".
A Cebuano delicacy served in rectangular bars wrapped in white paper, originating from Mandaue, Cebu. Made of finely mashed peanuts on sugar syrup.
Besides lechon, what other pork delicacy hails from Carcar?

Give five old names/spellings/aliases of Cebu.
